words.def: A popular feed format developed as an alternative to RSS.
words.name: Atom

words.def: Automated form of podcasting that allows bloggers and blog readers to generate audio versions of text blogs from RSS feeds.
words.name: Autocasting

words.def: A blog where the posts consist mainly of voice recordings sent by mobile phone, sometimes with some short text message added for metadata purposes. (cf. podcasting)
words.name: Audioblog

words.def: A law blog.
words.name: Blawg

words.def: An entry in a blog requesting information or contributions. A portmanteau of "blog" and "beg". Also called "Lazyweb".
words.name: Bleg

words.def: A blog article that contains links to other articles covering a specific topic. Most blog carnivals are hosted by a rotating list of frequent contributors to the carnival, and serve to both generate new posts by contributors and highlight new bloggers posting matter in that subject area.
words.name: Blog Carnival

words.def: (weblog client) is software to manage (post, edit) blogs from operating system with no need to launch a web browser. A typical blog client has an editor, a spell-checker and a few more options that simplify content creation and editing.
words.name: Blog client

words.def: A software which is used to create the blog. Some of the most popular are WordPress, Blogger, TypePad, Movable Type and Joomla.
words.name: Blog publishing service

words.def: Person who runs a blog. Also blogger.com, a popular blog hosting web site. Rarely: weblogger.
words.name: Blogger

words.def: Blogs written by and for Mormons (a portmanteau of "blog" and "Tabernacle"). Generally refers to faithful Mormon bloggers and sometimes refers to a specific grouping of faithful Mormon bloggers.
words.name: Bloggernacle

words.def: One of the most popular blog awards.
words.name: Bloggies

words.def: A list of other blogs that a blogger might recommend by providing links to them (usually in a sidebar list).
words.name: Blogroll

words.def: All blogs, or the blogging community.
words.name: Blogosphere

words.def: A category of software which consists of a specialized form of a Content Management System specifically designed for creating and maintaining weblogs.
words.name: Blogware

words.def: The largest international blog awards.
words.name: The BOBs

words.def: The practice of posting pictures of cats, in typical cat postures and expressions, on a blog.
words.name: Catblogging (traditionally "Friday catblogging", sometime "Caturday")

words.def: A blog (usually focused on a single issue or political stripe) on which multiple users enjoy posting permission. Also known as group blog.
words.name: Collaborative blog

words.def: Like e-mail spam. Robot “spambots” flood a blog with advertising in the form of bogus comments. A serious problem that requires bloggers and blog platforms to have tools to exclude some users or ban some addresses in comments.
words.name: Comment spam

words.def: An off-line blog management (posting, editing and archiving) tool
words.name: Desktop Blogging Client

words.def: A new kind of a trend in marketers in which they create new blogs for upcoming events. For that, they buy EMDs or exact match domains for the upcoming events to attract people who are searching for that event. Because their domain is rich with keywords — they get better rankings in search engines. However, to establish an event blog — event bloggers start working on their blogs even before 6 months of the event to make decent amount of content and to get quality backlinks.[1]
words.name: Event blogging

words.def: To rebut a blog entry in a line-by-line fashion.
words.name: Fisking

words.def: A portmanteau of "fake" and "blog"; a form of astroturfing.
words.name: Flog

words.def: RSS Feeds.
words.name: Feeds

words.def: A blog that covers health topics, events and/or related content of the health industry and the general community. In short, anything related to health.
words.name: Health blog

words.def: A journalist blog.
words.name: J-blog

words.def: A blog about law.
words.name: Legal blog

words.def: A blog that captures a person's entire life.
words.name: Lifelog

words.def: A blog consisting solely of list style posts.
words.name: List blog

words.def: A short-form of writing that uses a list as its thematic structure, but is fleshed out with sufficient copy to be published as an article.
words.name: Listicle

words.def: A blog that focuses primarily on the topic of literature.
words.name: Litblog

words.def: Term for blogs written by members or veterans of any branch of military service - Army, Navy, Air Force, or Marines. A contraction of military and blog.
words.name: Milblog

words.def: A portmanteau of "mobile" and "blog". A blog featuring posts sent mainly by mobile phone, using SMS or MMS messages. They are often photoblogs.
words.name: Moblog

words.def: A blog featuring discussions especially about home and family.
words.name: Mommy blog

words.def: A blog constructed as a conversation between more than two people.
words.name: Multiblog

words.def: Permanent link. The unique URL of a single post. Use this when you want to link to a post somewhere.
words.name: Permalink

words.def: Type of blog utilising the Gopher protocol instead of HTTP
words.name: Phlog

words.def: A blog mostly containing photos, posted constantly and chronologically.
words.name: Photoblog

words.def: The alert in the TrackBack system that notifies the original poster of a blog post when someone else writes an entry concerning the original post.
words.name: Pingback

words.def: Contraction of “iPod” and “broadcasting” (but not for iPods only). Posting audio and video material on a blog and its RSS feed, for digital players.
words.name: Podcasting

words.def: An entry written and published to a blog.
words.name: Post

words.def: For blogs with common language URLs, the post slug is the portion of the URL that represents the post. Example: http://www.forexchef.definanz-artikel-slug
words.name: Post Slug

words.def: Really Simple Syndication is a family of Web feed formats used to publish frequently updated content such as blog entries, news headlines or podcasts.
words.name: RSS

words.def: Software or online service allowing a blogger to read an RSS feed, especially the latest posts on their favourite blogs. Also called a reader, or feedreader.
words.name: RSS aggregator

words.def: The file containing a blog’s latest posts. It is read by an RSS aggregator/reader and shows at once when a blog has been updated. It may contain only the title of the post, the title plus the first few lines of a post, or the entire post.
words.name: RSS feed

words.def: or, for short, SEF URLs, implemented via URL mapping.
words.name: Search engine friendly URLs

words.def: A blog which is composed of spam. A Spam blog or "any blog whose creator doesn't add any written value."
words.name: Spam blog

words.def: The Slashdot effect can hit blogs or other website, and is caused by a major website (usually Slashdot, but also Digg, Metafilter, Boing Boing, Instapundit and others) sending huge amounts of temporary traffic that often slow down the server.
words.name: Slashdot effect

words.def: The term used when a blogs feed is added to a feed reader like Bloglines or Google. Some blogging platforms have internal subscriptions, this allows readers to receive notification when there are new posts in a blog. A subscriber is a person who is willing to receive blogger's news and updates.
words.name: Subscribe

words.def: Templates, used on the "back end" of a blog that work together to handle information and present it on a blog.
words.name: Templates

words.def: CSS based code that when applied to the templates will result in visual element changes to the blog. The theme, as a whole, is also referred to as a blog design.
words.name: Theme

words.def: A system that allows a blogger to see who has seen the original post and has written another entry concerning it. The system works by sending a 'ping' between the blogs, and therefore providing the alert.
words.name: TrackBack

words.def: A video blog; a vlogger is a video blogger (e.g. someone who records himself interviewing people of a certain field).
words.name: Vlog

words.def: A blog devoted mostly or wholly to covering news events concerning an ongoing war.
words.name: Warblog

words.def: The unshortened version of 'blog'.
words.name: Weblog

words.def: Blogging
words.name: History
